paragraphs.zh-tw: So yeah, I'm a newspaper cartoonist -- political cartoonist. I don't know if you've heard about it -- newspapers? It's a sort of paper-based reader.
paragraphs.en: 所以,是的,我是個漫畫家-- 畫報紙上政治諷刺漫畫的漫畫家 不知道各位知不知道報紙這東西 他是種印在紙上的讀物

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's lighter than an iPad, it's a bit cheaper. You know what they say? They say the print media is dying -- who says that? Well, the media.
paragraphs.en: 他比iPad要來的輕 也比較便宜 你知道嗎,現在很多人在說 說印刷業正在凋零 但是是誰這麼說的?是媒體自己

paragraphs.zh-tw: But this is no news, right? You've read about it already. Ladies and gentlemen, the world has gotten smaller.
paragraphs.en: 不過,這已經不是新聞了,對吧? 大家都已經讀過了 [印刷業正在凋零/這我昨天就在網路上讀過了] 各位先生女士們 這個世界變得越來越小

paragraphs.zh-tw: I know it's a cliche, but look, look how small, how tiny it has gotten. And you know the reason why, of course.
paragraphs.en: 我知道這很老掉牙,但你們看, 看,那麼小 它變的多微小 而你也知道為什麼它會變成這樣,當然,

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is because of technology -- yeah. Any computer designers in the room? Yeah well, you guys are making my life miserable because track pads used to be round, a nice round shape.
paragraphs.en: 是因為科技 這裡有哪位是做電腦設計師的嗎? 恩,好吧, 你們害我好難工作, 因為觸控板以前都是圓的, 方便的圓形,

paragraphs.zh-tw: That makes a good cartoon. But what are you going to do with a flat track pad, those square things? There's nothing I can do as a cartoonist.
paragraphs.en: 很適合用來當漫畫題材. 可是現在 你要我怎麼用平平的觸控板搞笑? 用那些方方的東西? 以我一個漫畫家而言這完全不能拿來用

paragraphs.zh-tw: Well, I know the world is flat now. That's true.
paragraphs.en: 好啦,我知道現在世界是平的 這是真的

paragraphs.zh-tw: And the Internet has reached every corner of the world, the poorest, the remotest places. Every village in Africa now has a cyber cafe.
paragraphs.en: 而網路也已經遍及 全世界各個角落 甚至觸及最窮困最偏遠的地方 隨便一個非洲村落現在都有網路咖啡店 [網路咖啡廳/不供應咖啡]

paragraphs.zh-tw: Don't go asking for a Frappuccino there. So we are bridging the digital divide.
paragraphs.en: 可別去那裏點星冰樂 所以,我們正在彌補數位差距

paragraphs.zh-tw: The Third World is connected, we are connected. And what happens next? Well, you've got mail.
paragraphs.en: 第三世界連上了網路 我們也連上網路 那麼接下來會發生什麼事呢? 於是,你收到新郵件[第三世界現在也上線囉!/郵件:我好餓!]

paragraphs.zh-tw: Yeah. Well, the Internet has empowered us.
paragraphs.en: 是的 網路賦予我們力量

paragraphs.zh-tw: It has empowered you, it has empowered me and it has empowered some other guys as well. You know, these last two cartoons -- I did them live during a conference in Hanoi.
paragraphs.en: 他給了你力量, 給了我力量, 也給了其他的某些人力量 你知道,剛才這兩幅漫畫, 是我在河內的漫畫大會上 現場畫的

paragraphs.zh-tw: And they were not used to that in communist 2.0 Vietnam. So I was cartooning live on a wide screen -- it was quite a sensation -- and then this guy came to me.
paragraphs.en: 而在那個還在用共產黨政府2.0的越南, 他們不太習慣畫這種諷刺漫畫 我做畫的實況當時被放送到大螢幕上, 得到了不少好評 那之後有一個人跑來找我

paragraphs.zh-tw: He was taking pictures of me and of my sketches, and I thought, "This is great, a Vietnamese fan." And as he came the second day, I thought, "Wow, that's really a cartoon lover." And on the third day, I finally understood, the guy was actually on duty. So by now, there must be a hundred pictures of me smiling with my sketches in the files of the Vietnamese police.
paragraphs.en: 他幫我和我的畫拍照 我以為"太好了,我有了一個越南畫迷" 他第二天也有來, 我想"哇,他真是一個熱情的漫畫迷" 直到第三天,我才發現 這傢伙其實是在執行任務 所以現在,他大概有上百張我 跟我的畫微笑的照片 儲存在越南警方的檔案庫裡

paragraphs.zh-tw: No, but it's true: the Internet has changed the world. It has rocked the music industry; it has changed the way we consume music.
paragraphs.en: 不,但這是真的:網路改變了世界 網路也動搖了整個音樂產業 它改變了我們消費音樂的方式

paragraphs.zh-tw: For those of you old enough to remember, we used to have to go to the store to steal it. And it has changed the way your future employer will look at your application.
paragraphs.en: 我們之中一些年紀比較大的人會記得, 我們以前會需要去店舖裡才能夠, 偷音樂 [網路改變了音樂/以前都必須去唱片行才偷的了] 網路也改變了 未來你的雇主們 審查你的就業申請的方式

paragraphs.zh-tw: So be careful with that Facebook account -- your momma told you, be careful. And technology has set us free -- this is free WiFi.
paragraphs.en: 所以請小心 你那個臉書帳戶 你媽媽告訴過你,小心哪 科技也讓我們自由 這是免費無線網路的標誌

paragraphs.zh-tw: But yeah, it has liberated us from the office desk. This is your life, enjoy it.
paragraphs.en: 不過,真的,它將我們 從辦公桌前解放 這是你的生活 好好的享受它吧

paragraphs.zh-tw: In short, technology, the internet, they have changed our lifestyle. Tech guru, like this man -- that a German magazine called the philosopher of the 21st century -- they are shaping the way we do things.
paragraphs.en: 簡而言之,科技,網路 它們改變了我們的生活習慣 科技大師,像是這位-- 這個被德國雜誌封為二十一世紀的哲學家的人-- 他們塑造了我們辦事的方式[蘋果電腦創辦人: 史提夫·賈伯斯]

paragraphs.zh-tw: They are shaping the way we consume. They are shaping our very desires.
paragraphs.en: 他們塑造了我們的消費模式 和我們的慾望 [這會幫助你簡化許多以前根本就不用做的工作] (鼓掌)

paragraphs.zh-tw: You will not like it. And technology has even changed our relationship to God.
paragraphs.en: 你不會喜歡的 科技甚至也改變了 我們與神之間的關係 [神父大人,我犯了罪.../(google中)恩我知道]

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now I shouldn't get into this. Religion and political cartoons, as you may have heard, make a difficult couple, ever since that day of 2005, when a bunch of cartoonists in Denmark drew cartoons that had repercussions all over the world -- demonstrations, fatwa, they provoked violence. People died in the violence.
paragraphs.en: 噢我不該討論這個的 宗教跟政治諷刺漫畫, 就如同你們可能聽說過的, 他們一直是對冤家 自從2005年的某一天開始, 當一群丹麥漫畫家 畫了一些在全世界造成激烈反應的漫畫 示威遊行,伊斯蘭教令裁決 他們引起暴力,許多人們便死於這些暴力

paragraphs.zh-tw: This was so sickening; people died because of cartoons. I mean -- I had the feeling at the time that cartoons had been used by both sides, actually.
paragraphs.en: 這真是令人惶恐難受 人竟然因漫畫而死 我的意思是-- 我那個時候就覺得 其實,漫畫都被雙方利用過

paragraphs.zh-tw: They were used first by a Danish newspaper, which wanted to make a point on Islam. A Danish cartoonist told me he was one of the 24 who received the assignment to draw the prophet -- 12 of them refused. Did you know that? He told me, "Nobody has to tell me what I should draw.
paragraphs.en: 它們被用在丹麥報紙上 指責伊斯蘭教 有個漫畫家告訴我他是那24個 接到報社要求畫伊斯蘭先知的漫畫家的其中一位 但其中12位都拒絕了.這你知道嗎? 他說"沒有人可以命令我該畫什麼,

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is not how it works." And then, of course, they were used by extremists and politicians on the other side. They wanted to stir up controversy.
paragraphs.en: 漫畫不是這樣畫的" 當然,漫畫也被另一方的 激進分子和政治家使用過 他們想要掀起一番爭議

paragraphs.zh-tw: You know the story. We know that cartoons can be used as weapons.
paragraphs.en: 故事大家都知道不用我贅述 漫畫可以被用作為武器

paragraphs.zh-tw: History tells us, they've been used by the Nazis to attack the Jews. And here we are now.
paragraphs.en: 歷史告訴我們, 漫畫就曾是納粹 用來攻擊猶太人的武器 而現在,

paragraphs.zh-tw: In the United Nations, half of the world is pushing to penalize the offense to religion -- they call it the defamation of religion -- while the other half of the world is fighting back in defense of freedom of speech. So the clash of civilizations is here, and cartoons are at the middle of it? This got me thinking.
paragraphs.en: 在聯合國 半數的國家都在推動 對侮辱宗教的處罰-- 他們稱此為反對宗教詆毀案-- 與此同時另一半的世界 正在為了保護言論自由而反擊 於是我們有了文明衝突 而在這戰火正中央的竟然是漫畫? 這逼得我思考

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now you see me thinking at my kitchen table, and since you're in my kitchen, please meet my wife. In 2006, a few months after, I went Ivory Coast -- Western Africa.
paragraphs.en: 我思考著 坐在我家廚房餐桌前 既然你已經進了我家廚房, 那也見見我太太吧 [我在尋找我人生的意義/你要不要google看看] 2006年,幾個月之後, 我去到西非的-- 象牙海岸

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, talk of a divided place -- the country was cut in two. You had a rebellion in the North, the government in the South -- the capital, Abidjan -- and in the middle, the French army.
paragraphs.en: 這是個面臨分裂的國家,一個國家切成兩半 反抗軍位於北部, 政府位於南方--首都,阿比讓-- 在中間的則是法國軍隊

paragraphs.zh-tw: This looks like a giant hamburger. You don't want to be the ham in the middle.
paragraphs.en: 這看起來像個巨型漢堡 你不會想當那夾在中央的火腿肉的

paragraphs.zh-tw: I was there to report on that story in cartoons. I've been doing this for the last 15 years; it's my side job, if you want.
paragraphs.en: 我到那裏是為了報導一則故事 透過漫畫 我做這個工作已經十五年了 可以說,這是我的兼職

paragraphs.zh-tw: So you see the style is different. This is more serious than maybe editorial cartooning.
paragraphs.en: 我用的畫風也和平常不太一樣 畫的比報紙社上的論漫畫來的嚴肅些

paragraphs.zh-tw: I went to places like Gaza during the war in 2009. So this is really journalism in cartoons.
paragraphs.en: 我也去過像是加薩走廊 當時正值2009年戰爭時期 所以這其實是用漫畫在報導新聞

paragraphs.zh-tw: You'll hear more and more about it. This is the future of journalism, I think.
paragraphs.en: 以後這會變得很常見 我覺得這是新聞未來的走向

paragraphs.zh-tw: And of course, I went to see the rebels in the north. Those were poor guys fighting for their rights.
paragraphs.en: 當然我也去採訪了象牙海岸北部的反抗軍 這群貧困的人為了自身的權利戰鬥著

paragraphs.zh-tw: There was an ethnic side to this conflict as very often in Africa. And I went to see the Dozo.
paragraphs.en: 這場衝突跟很多其他非洲的衝突一樣 和族裔之間的問題有關 我去見了Dozo人

paragraphs.zh-tw: The Dozo, they are the traditional hunters of West Africa. People fear them -- they help the rebellion a lot.
paragraphs.en: Dozo人是西非的 傳統獵人 大家都怕他們 他們經常幫助反抗軍

paragraphs.zh-tw: They are believed to have magical powers. They can disappear and escape bullets.
paragraphs.en: 並且被視為擁有魔力 可以隨意消失,也能躲避子彈

paragraphs.zh-tw: I went to see a Dozo chief; he told me about his magical powers. He said, "I can chop your head off right away and bring you back to life." I said, "Well, maybe we don't have time for this right now." "Another time." So back in Abidjan, I was given a chance to lead a workshop with local cartoonists there and I thought, yes, in a context like this, cartoons can really be used as weapons against the other side.
paragraphs.en: 我去和一位Dozo領袖會面 他和我介紹他的魔力 他說"我現在可以馬上砍掉你的頭 隨後讓你復活" 我說"好吧,可是我想現在我們應該沒空做這個" "下次吧" 回到阿比讓, 我得到了一個在工作坊 指導當地漫畫家的機會 我想,是的 在這樣的大環境之下,漫畫極有可能 成為對付另一方的武器

paragraphs.zh-tw: I mean, the press in Ivory Coast was bitterly divided -- it was compared to the media in Rwanda before the genocide -- so imagine. And what can a cartoonist do? Sometimes editors would tell their cartoonists to draw what they wanted to see, and the guy has to feed his family, right? So the idea was pretty simple.
paragraphs.en: 我的意思是,象牙海岸的媒體分裂成敵對的兩邊 有人將他們兩邊的關係和 大屠殺之前的盧安達媒體相提並論 就請各位想像一下 那麼在這種情況下漫畫家能怎麼辦? 有時候編輯會命令漫畫家 照著編輯的想法畫漫畫 但漫畫家也不會反抗,畢竟他必須養家餬口 我的想法很簡單

paragraphs.zh-tw: We brought together cartoonists from all sides in Ivory Coast. We took them away from their newspaper for three days.
paragraphs.en: 我們將所有站在各種立場的象牙海岸漫畫家 聚集起來 帶他們離開報社影響三天

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I asked them to do a project together, tackle the issues affecting their country in cartoons, yes, in cartoons. Show the positive power of cartoons.
paragraphs.en: 請他們一起完成一份作業 用漫畫解決他們的國家正在面臨的種種問題 是的,用漫畫 展現漫畫的正向力量

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's a great tool of communication for bad or for good. And cartoons can cross boundaries, as you have seen.
paragraphs.en: 漫畫是個很好的溝通工具 不論用於傳達的訊息是好是壞 漫畫有跨越藩籬力量 我們都見識過

paragraphs.zh-tw: And humor is a good way, I think, to address serious issues. And I'm very proud of what they did.
paragraphs.en: 我認為幽默也是個面對嚴肅問題 之時很好的態度 我為這些漫畫家最後的成果感到驕傲

paragraphs.zh-tw: I mean, they didn't agree with each other -- that was not the point. And I didn't ask them to do nice cartoons.
paragraphs.en: 他們並沒有同意互相的論點--那不是意義所在 我也沒有請他們畫故作融洽的漫畫

paragraphs.zh-tw: The first day, they were even shouting at each other. But they came up with a book, looking back at 13 years of political crisis in Ivory Coast.
paragraphs.en: 第一天的時候他們甚至大吵了一架 但最終他們完成了一本書 回顧這過去十三年來 象牙海岸所經歷過的政治危機

paragraphs.zh-tw: So the idea was there. And I've been doing projects like this, in 2009 in Lebanon, this year in Kenya, back in January.
paragraphs.en: 所以這個想法便誕生了 我一直在做像這樣的工作 2009年在黎巴嫩 今年的一月份,則是在肯亞

paragraphs.zh-tw: In Lebanon, it was not a book. The idea was to have -- the same principal, a divided country -- take cartoonists from all sides and let them do something together.
paragraphs.en: 在黎巴嫩,最後的成果不是本書 我們的理念是讓-- 一樣的原理, 一個分裂的國家-- 聚集起所有不同立場的漫畫家 讓他們一起做些什麼

paragraphs.zh-tw: So in Lebanon, we enrolled the newspaper editors, and we got them to publish eight cartoonists from all sides all together on the same page, addressing the issue affecting Lebanon, like religion in politics and everyday life. And it worked.
paragraphs.en: 在黎巴嫩 我們招收報紙編輯們 讓他們幫忙出版 八位來自不同政治立場漫畫家的漫畫印在同一個報紙版面上 探討影響黎巴嫩的時事 例如政治裡的宗教和人民的日常生活 它成功了

paragraphs.zh-tw: For three days, almost all the newspapers of Beirut published all those cartoonists together -- anti-government, pro-government, Christian, Muslim, of course, English-speaking, well, you name it. So this was a great project.
paragraphs.en: 三天以來,幾乎所有貝魯特的報紙 都一起印了那些漫畫-- 反政府的, 支持政府的, 基督教的, 當然也有伊斯蘭教的, 英文報紙,只要你說得出來的報紙,通通都有 這是個很傑出的企劃

paragraphs.zh-tw: And then in Kenya, what we did was addressing the issue of ethnicity, which is a poison in a lot of places in Africa. And we did video clips -- you can see them if you go to YouTube/Kenyatoons.
paragraphs.en: 之後在肯亞,我們做的 則是審視族群問題 這個問題侵害非洲很多地方猶如毒藥一般 我們做了一些短片 如果你想觀賞它們的話,請上YouTube/ Kenya Tunes.

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, preaching for freedom of speech is easy here, but as you have seen in contexts of repression or division, again, what can a cartoonist do? He has to keep his job. Well I believe that in any context anywhere, he always has the choice at least not to do a cartoon that will feed hatred.
paragraphs.en: 所以,雖然為言論自由發聲 在這裡是件簡單的事情 可是,就像你看到的 在充滿壓迫或是歧見的地方 我們要再次問到, 漫畫家能做什麼? 他必須保全他的工作 我相信在任何的環境任何的地方 他至少隨時都可以選擇 不去畫一篇 會餵養憎恨的漫畫

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that's the message I try to convey to them. I think we all always have the choice in the end not to do the bad thing.
paragraphs.en: 這就是我想要向他們傳達的理念 我相信我們最終都有這一個選項 不去做壞事

paragraphs.zh-tw: But we need to support these [unclear], critical and responsible voices in Africa, in Lebanon, in your local newspaper, in the Apple store. Today, tech companies are the world's largest editors.
paragraphs.en: 可是我們也需要支持 這些[不清晰],關鍵性的 負責任的聲音 不論是在非洲,在黎巴嫩 在地區性的報紙上, 還是在蘋果電腦的商店裡 今天,科技公司 是世界上最有影響力的編輯

paragraphs.zh-tw: They decide what is too offensive or too provocative for you to see. So really, it's not about the freedom of cartoonists; it's about your freedoms.
paragraphs.en: 他們決定了什麼太有具攻擊性 什麼又是太過煽動,不適合你看 所以,我的演講其實不是在談漫畫家的自由 而是關於你的自由

paragraphs.zh-tw: And for dictators all over the world, the good news is when cartoonists, journalists and activists shut up. Thank you.
paragraphs.en: 畢竟對全世界的獨裁者來說 最好的消息 就是當漫畫家 記者和社會運動家閉嘴都的時候了 謝謝大家 (鼓掌)

title: Patrick Chappatte The Power Of Cartoons
